suncertify.db
Interface Session

public interface Session

Defines a unique access to a database file engine.

An instance can be obtained by calling Engine.newSession(). Each session created by a database engine has its unique ID and access to the database file data through interface DBMain returned by calling getDataAccess(). discard() discards this session from use, discarding a session free all resources locked by this session.

Author:
Mohammad S. Abdellatif
See Also:
Engine, DBMain

Method Summary

          Discard this session for use and release all resources locked by it.
 DBMain getDataAccess()
          Get this session access to database file records.

          Get the engine which this session belongs to.
 java.lang.String getId()
          The unique ID for this session cross same engine.
 boolean isValid()
          Returns if this session is valid or not.
 

Method Detail

getId

java.lang.String getId()
The unique ID for this session cross same engine.

Returns:
session unique ID.

getEngine

Engine getEngine()
Get the engine which this session belongs to.

Returns:
session engine.

getDataAccess

DBMain getDataAccess()
Get this session access to database file records.

Multiple calls to this method will return the same instance and it will throw an IllegalStateException in case discard() was called.

Returns:
session access to database file records.

discard

void discard()
Discard this session for use and release all resources locked by it.

Any call to instance method returned by getDataAccess() will throw an IllegalStateException.

isValid

boolean isValid()
Returns if this session is valid or not.

A session is invalid for mostly after calling discard().

Returns:
true if a session is valid for use, otherwise, false.
